chefkaspa,"2018-07-29T11:07:41.32Z","Take up the challenge","

(I have edited my original review when I purchased the set 04/19.)

Back in July 2018 I didn't want to wait for the set to be released. Thus my first building attempt was done from early official pictures that were available from the internet (cf. my review of 42075). Eventually I could improve towards an operating version when photos of the inside modules were shown in forums, e.g. before instructions got published.
Parts
There is a good, useful selection of technic elements.
<ul>

column2: • I would like to mention that drivers seat is not blue
• Some non-technic parts are thrown in for the palette and drum

column1: Assembly
The model is assembled from smaller units that represent its functions:
<ul>
These small building blocks allow to make adaptations of your choice. Functions can easily be replaced or extended. There is some space to do that.
The finished model resembles the forklift from 8872 set but is considerable larger.
Functions
It does what you expect from a forklift:
<ul>
(There is a nice comparison with former sets by Huw).
Additionally:
<ul>

column2: • Two-cylinder motor driven from front wheels via differential
• Pallette with drum - to play with and store away

column1: Rating
I like the colour scheme. The dark blue goes well with the yellow.
All functions are working well, but playability is somewhat limited:
<ul>

column2: • Steering has been poorly done as the vehicle turns in the opposite direction of steering.
• The maximum lifting height is limited to 14..15 studs (only).
• As with previous forklifts, the tilt has only two useable positions.

column1: Because of its modularity and since there is plenty of space inside the truck I suggest that you try some modifications on this set.
For example: It does not take many extra parts to fix the steering.
(Modification of lift mechanism that resembles the one from 8416. Height is increased to 22 studs.)
Conclusion
I originally rated this set with "3" because of the not-so-well done functions. However, I now included the fun time that I spent to improve and modify.

You need not to stop building with the completed set. This is a nice model that challenges you to tweak it to your own needs. There is plenty of space available to do so. It is possible to fit in a small actuator for tilt:

This forklift is a great toy and display piece.
You turn the light on top of the cab to raise and lower the load.
You turn the exhaust pipe to steer.
There is a lever just below the cab for changing the angle of the boom.
Other features include simulated mirrors, moving pistons, cab details, and a cargo pallet.
Pros
This set never fails to intrigue anyone interested in how things work, looks great and is sturdy and playable.
Cons
The boom cannot lock itself into a vertical position.
